conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and understand the thermodynamic processes.
Diagram shows two adiabatic (curved lines) and two isochoric (vertical lines) processes with states labeled as a, b, c, and d.
Adiabatic processes: no heat exchange, PV^Î³ = constant.
Isochoric processes: volume constant, work done is zero.
For adiabatic process, if volume increases, temperature decreases and vice versa.
From c to b: Volume decreases, temperature increases.
From d to a: Volume increases, temperature decreases.
For isochoric process, pressure proportional to temperature.
From b to d: Pressure decreases, temperature decreases.
From c to a: Pressure decreases, temperature decreases.
State c is at higher pressure and lower volume compared to state a.
Moving from c to b increases temperature.
Moving from b to d decreases temperature.
Moving from d to a further decreases temperature.
Overall, state c has a higher temperature than state a.
Internal energy at state c is greater than at state a.
